intro: Microcoelia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered microcoelia, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, linear leaves arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets, with the outer florets being bright yellow and the inner ones orange. Microcoelia macrantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
